scenario.name: Verify that MAS switches between available service instances
scenario.send:
INVITE sip:[field1]@[remote_ip]:[remote_port] SIP/2.0 Via: SIP/2.0/[transport] [local_ip]:[local_port];branch=[branch] From: <sip:[field0]@[local_ip]:[local_port]>;tag=[call_number] To: sut <sip:111111@[remote_ip]:[remote_port]> Date: Tue, 16 Jan 2007 12:00:00 GMT Call-ID: [call_id] Supported: 100rel,timer,replaces Min-SE:1800 Cisco-Guid: 2197304900-2787119579-2612527107-3134601043 User-Agent: Cisco-SIPGateway/IOS-12.x Allow: INVITE, OPTIONS, BYE, CANCEL, ACK, PRACK, COMET, REFER, SUBSCRIBE, NOTIFY, IN FO, UPDATE, REGISTER CSeq: 102 INVITE Max-Forwards: 70 Remote-Party-ID: <sip:[field0]@[local_ip]>;party=calling;screen=yes;privacy=off Timestamp: 1100000000 Contact: <sip:[field0]@[local_ip]:[local_port]> Diversion: <sip:333333@[local_ip]>;reason=unknown Expires: 180 Allow-Events: telephone-event Content-Type: application/sdp Content-Length: [len]
v=0 o=CiscoSystemsSIP-GW-UserAgent 5928 8051 IN IP[local_ip_type] [local_ip] s=SIP Call c=IN IP[media_ip_type] [media_ip] t=0 0 m=audio [media_port] RTP/AVP 0 101 a=rtpmap:0 PCMU/8000 a=rtpmap:101 telephone-event/8000 a=fmtp:101 0-16 a=ptime:20

ACK sip:[field1]@[remote_ip]:[remote_port] SIP/2.0 Via: SIP/2.0/[transport] [local_ip]:[local_port];branch=[branch] From: sipp <sip:[field0]@[local_ip]:[local_port]>;tag=[call_number] To: sut <sip:111111@[remote_ip]:[remote_port]>[peer_tag_param] Date: Tue, 16 Jan 2007 12:00:00 GMT Call-ID: [call_id] Max-Forwards: 70 CSeq: 102 ACK Content-Length: 0

BYE sip:111111@[remote_ip]:[remote_port]; SIP/2.0 Via: SIP/2.0/[transport] [local_ip]:[local_port];branch=[branch] From: sipp <sip:[field0]@[local_ip]:[local_port]>;tag=[call_number] To: sut <sip:111111@[remote_ip]:[remote_port]>[peer_tag_param] Date: Tue, 16 Jan 2007 12:00:00 GMT Call-ID: [call_id] User-Agent: Cisco-SIPGateway/IOS-12.x Max-Forwards: 70 Timestamp: 1100000000 CSeq: 103 BYE Reason: Q.850;cause=16 Content-Length: 0
